main event: A U.S. Army sergeant reported seeing a large, sphere-shaped object maneuvering in the sky near Brooklyn, New York on February 23, 1956.
interesting points: The object appeared to be 'wobbling or fluttering' in the air.
The object was described as much larger than a conventional aircraft.
The object was moving in the direction of lower New York Bay.
The sergeant was unsure if he could accurately identify the object as an aircraft.
result: Probable misinterpretation of a conventional aircraft based on the maneuvers and general description
